Name: Vientiane
Description: Vientiane (Lao: ວຽງຈັນ, Vieng Chan) is the capital of Laos.

Name: Houay Xai
Description: Houay Xai (also Huay xai, Houei Sai, etc) is the capital of the Laos province of Bokeo. It lies on the banks of the Mekong River, which forms the border to Thailand.

Name: Luang Namtha
Description: Luang Namtha (ຫຼວງນໍ້າທາ, ຫລວງນໍ້າທາ Louangnamtha, Luang Nam Tha) is the largest city in Luang Nam Tha Province, Northern Laos. It lies on the banks of the Nam Tha River, and the meaning of the name is "The area (luang) around the Tha River (nam Tha)".

Name: Luang Prabang
Description: Luang Prabang, or Louangphrabang (Lao: ຫຼວງພຣະບາງ) is the former capital of Laos and a UNESCO World Heritage city.

Name: Pakbeng
Description: Pakbeng is in Bakeo Province, Northern Laos.

Name: Pakse
Description: Pakse (ປາກເຊ) is a city in the Champasak province of Southern Laos.  It's one of the biggest cities in Laos and a major transportation hub for southern Laos. If you plan to go to the Bolaven Plateau, Wat Phou, or Si Phan Don you will probably have to spend some time here.

Name: Savannakhet
Description: Savannakhet (ສະຫວັນນະເຂດ, commonly abbreviated to "Savan") and more officially mentioned as "Kaysone Phomvihane" (ໄກສອນ ພົມວິຫານ, name of the district), is the capital of Savannakhet Province in Southern Laos. It is on the Mekong River. With an estimated population of 120,000 it is the second largest city of Laos. The city is the hub between west (Mukdahan, Thailand) and east (Vietnam), and between north (Vientiane) and south (Pakse).

Name: Tha Khaek
Description: Tha Khek (ທ່າແຂກ) is the main town in Khammouane Province, in Central Laos.

Name: Ban Nalan Trail
Description: Ban Nalan Trail is in Northern Laos and is a two day trekking experience.

Name: Bolaven Plateau
Description: Bolaven Plateau (ພູພຽງບໍລະເວນ Pupyang Bolaven) is in Southern Laos.

Name: Champasak
Description: Champasak is a province of Southern Laos.  It's best known for a series of Khmer ruins, collectively named a UNESCO World Heritage Site as the Champasak Cultural Landscape.

Name: Nong Khiaw
Description: Nong Khiaw (Nong Kiau or Nong Kiew) is a rustic little town on the bank of the Ou River in Laos. It is squeezed in between some of the most fantastic limestone mountains to be found north of Vang Vieng.

Name: Plain of Jars
Description: The Plain of Jars is in Central Laos. Information about staying in the Plain of Jars can be found on the page about Phonsavan.

Name: Si Phan Don
Description: Si Phan Don (Four Thousand Islands, Lao: ສີພັນດອນ) is a group of islands in the Mekong River in Southern Laos.

Name: Vang Vieng
Description: Vang Vieng (ວັງວຽງ) (also Vang Viang) is a riverside town in Central Laos.

Name: Vieng Xai
Description: Vieng Xai is a city in Hua Phan Province, Laos.
